metadata.title: Pulmonary Function and Clinical Manifestations of Patients Infected with Mild Influenza A Virus Subtype H1N1: A One-Year Follow-Up

abstract.original_text: To investigate the long-term effects of mild H1N1 influenza infection on the pulmonary function of a cohort of patients.

sentences.segment_text: To investigate the long-term effects of mild H1N1 influenza infection on the pulmonary function of a cohort of patients .

abstract.original_text: Forty-eight patients, all diagnosed with influenza A virus subtype H1N1 in 2009, were retrospectively included in this study. Each patient in the study was monitored for 11-13 months by standard pulmonary function examination. The examination included monitoring respiratory tract infection symptoms (cough, expectoration or gasping) and vital signs. Long-term changes in symptoms and changes in vital signs were correlated back to and compared with the severity of the initial H1N1 influenza infection.
